thegame.onScreenObjects

Class TextBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • thegame.onScreenObjects.TextBox

  • public class TextBox
extends java.lang.Object
    A text input field that can be rendered on screen. Provides user interaction features including text entry, focus handling, and password masking.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TextBox(float x, float y, float width, float height, java.lang.String placeholder)
      Creates a new text box with the specified position, size, and placeholder text.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Gets the height of the text box.

      Gets the current text content of the text box.
      float getWidth()
      Gets the width of the text box.
      float getX()
      Gets the x-coordinate of the text box.
      float getY()
      Gets the y-coordinate of the text box.
      void handleCharInput(int codepoint)
      Handles character input events for text entry.
      void handleKeyPress(int key, int action)
      Handles keyboard key press events, such as backspace for text deletion.
      boolean handleMouseClick(float mouseX, float mouseY)
      Handles mouse click events on the text box.
      boolean isFocused()
      Checks if the text box currently has focus.
      void render(float mouseX, float mouseY)
      Renders the text box with appropriate styling based on its state (focused, hovered).
      void setFocused(boolean focused)
      Sets the focus state of the text box.
      void setPasswordMode(boolean passwordMode)
      Sets whether the text box should mask input (for passwords).

      Sets the text content of the text box.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TextBox

        public TextBox(float x,
               float y,
               float width,
               float height,
               java.lang.String placeholder)
        Creates a new text box with the specified position, size, and placeholder text.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the top-left corner
        y - The y-coordinate of the top-left corner
        width - The width of the text box
        height - The height of the text box
        placeholder - The placeholder text to display when the text box is empty

    • Method Detail

      • render

        public void render(float mouseX,
                   float mouseY)
        Renders the text box with appropriate styling based on its state (focused, hovered). Also handles cursor blinking when the text box is focused.
        Parameters:
        mouseX - The current x-coordinate of the mouse
        mouseY - The current y-coordinate of the mouse

      • handleMouseClick

        public boolean handleMouseClick(float mouseX,
                                float mouseY)
        Handles mouse click events on the text box. Sets focus to the text box if clicked within its bounds.
        Parameters:
        mouseX - The x-coordinate of the mouse click
        mouseY - The y-coordinate of the mouse click
        Returns:
        true if the click was within the text box bounds, false otherwise

      • handleKeyPress

        public void handleKeyPress(int key,
                           int action)
        Handles keyboard key press events, such as backspace for text deletion. Only processes events when the text box is focused.
        Parameters:
        key - The key code of the pressed key
        action - The action (press, release, etc.)

      • handleCharInput

        public void handleCharInput(int codepoint)
        Handles character input events for text entry. Only processes input when the text box is focused.
        Parameters:
        codepoint - The Unicode code point of the character

      • getText

        public java.lang.String getText()
        Gets the current text content of the text box.
        Returns:
        The current text

      • setText

        public void setText(java.lang.String text)
        Sets the text content of the text box.
        Parameters:
        text - The new text content

      • isFocused

        public boolean isFocused()
        Checks if the text box currently has focus.
        Returns:
        true if the text box is focused, false otherwise

      • setFocused

        public void setFocused(boolean focused)
        Sets the focus state of the text box.
        Parameters:
        focused - true to give focus to the text box, false to remove focus

      • setPasswordMode

        public void setPasswordMode(boolean passwordMode)
        Sets whether the text box should mask input (for passwords). When in password mode, text is displayed as asterisks.
        Parameters:
        passwordMode - true to enable password masking, false to show plain text

      • getX

        public float getX()
        Gets the x-coordinate of the text box.
        Returns:
        The x-coordinate

      • getY

        public float getY()
        Gets the y-coordinate of the text box.
        Returns:
        The y-coordinate

      • getWidth

        public float getWidth()
        Gets the width of the text box.
        Returns:
        The width

      • getHeight

        public float getHeight()
        Gets the height of the text box.
        Returns:
        The height
